text:
The 2018 California gubernatorial election took place on 6 November 2018, and elected the next Governor of California. The incumbent governor, Jerry Brown, could not run in the election due to term limits.
Gavin Newsom easily won the election. Newsom's victory was the largest victory in a gubernatorial election in California since 1950.
Primary election.
The top-two candidates moved on to the general election. The primary election occurred on 5 June 2018.
Results by county.
Red represents counties won by Cox. Blue represents counties won by Newsom. Yellow represents counties won by Villaraigosa.
General election.
The general election took place on 6 November 2018.
Results by county.
Here are the results of the election by county.
